Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and identify a specific habitat either on land (like a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot) or in water (such as a pond, stream, or lake).

The student can illustrate and label at least three different types of living things found in their chosen habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can show patterns by comparing at least two different habitats and illustrating how the types of living things they draw differ between these habitats.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly display the diversity of plants and animals in the selected habitats.
The student can label their drawings to explain how the observed patterns provide evidence of plant and animal diversity in different habitats.
